Title: GFP to move adjournment motion over Mhadei issue
Content:
This story is from January 5, 2020

GFP president Vijai Sardesai

PANAJI: GFP on Saturday said that it would move an adjournment motion before the assembly to draw attention to the Mhadei water diversion issue. GFP president Vijai Sardesai said that the party would seek Congress and MGP’s support to see the motion is passed in the House.

Opposition leader and Congress MLA Digambar Kamat said that Congress Legislature Party (CLP) would deliberate on the issue on Monday.

“GFP will move an adjournment motion in this session. We know that under Rule 68 we need 1/6 of the strength of the House which we do not have. We will appeal to Congress and MGP and we will approach the independents to support us in the adjournment motion,” Sardesai said.

The primary objective of an adjournment motion is to draw the attention of the House to a recent matter of urgent public importance having serious implications for the state.

When contacted whether Congress would support the motion, Kamat told TOI, that he would have to put it up for discussion at the CLP. “We will discuss this issue. We will see what stand the party should take,” he said.

Interestingly, the GFP chief had rued the lack of consensus among the opposition. “The way the Mhadei should have got attention, it has not happened, and this is the collective failure of the opposition. We expect the opposition to be proactive. The opposition is going through a crisis,” Sardesai said.

Title: Pics of illegal guns on social media landed 21 in jail in ’19
Content:
This story is from January 5, 2020

Allahabad: Pratapgarh police arrested at least 21 youths in 2019 for posting pictures and videos on social media brandishing illegal firearms.

While the first such case surfaced in April in Lalganj, highest number of cases were reported in Maheshganj and Lalganj police station areas.

Superintendent of police (Pratapgarh) Abhishek Singh said such cases started declining after cops acted strictly against miscreants. “Police are spreading the message among youngsters that posing with guns on social media can land them in jail. Majority of youths who possessed illegal weapons and uploaded photographs or videos were from rural background. Cases were lodged against them under the Arms Act and they were sent to jail,” he said.

The SP said investigations revealed that over 80% youngsters who uploaded their videos or photographs with illegal weapons wanted to impress their friends and had no ill intention. “Highest number of cases were reported from Lalganj and Maheshganj police stations,” he added.

Cops are taking strict action against law-breakers to curb the practice as such people want to catch the imagination of lakhs of social media users. Crime branch and intelligence wing keep track of social media sites throughout the year to look for people posing with guns.

In last fortnight, police have traced at least three cases where old photographs or videos, dating back to 2015 or 2016, were uploaded on social media. Investigations found that some people uploaded old photographs of their rivals to settle scores with them.

“We are examining posts on social networking sites. While people posting pictures with illegal weapons are being arrested, we will act against those people too who are trying to settle scores with someone,” the SP said.

Cops are also trying to find out people supplying illegal weapons to them.

Title: Tearful adieu to Dr Minimol
Content:
This story is from January 5, 2020

Thiruvananthapuram: Doctors, staff members and students of Trivandrum Medical College Hospital on Saturday bid farewell to general surgery associate professor Dr Minimol K L , who was found dead inside her car near pathological lab of the Medical College campus on Friday evening under mysterious circumstances.

Colleagues, who had arrived at the morgue even before postmortem began on Saturday, said 45-year-old Minimol was a cheerful doctor who was equally efficient in her work. General surgery department head Dr Abdul Latheef said it took little time for Dr Minimol to get herself established as a prominent general surgeon. “She was known for her soft approach with the patients and for the precision of surgeries she conducted. Minimol’s expertise with paintings and art works was however less known. She enjoyed painting in her free time away from the hospital,” he said.

Minimol’s husband Dr Vinu C V, who is an associate professor of cardiothoracic department at Medical College Hospital, had approached Sreekaryam police station on Friday noon with a complaint that his wife was missing which led Sreekaryam police to launch a probe to track down the doctor. Police with the help of mobile tower location tracked down the doctor who was found sitting unconscious in the driving seat with a syringe injected in her hand around 6.30pm. While Minimol was rushed for treatment, her life could not be saved. The body was initially kept for public observance at the multi-speciality block and old auditorium for 15 minutes each before being transported to her residence at Alathara near Sreekaryam for cremation.

Sreekaryam sub-inspector K G Prathap Chandran, who is probing the case of unnatural death, said it is still too early to determine the exact cause of death. “The samples collected from the deceased have been sent for forensic examination. It will take at least a week to get the reports of postmortem and forensic examination. We found her with the syringe attached to her hand but details regarding the type of medicine used in the injection are still not clear,” the SI said.

Title: Dwarka flat scam: Cops file 13 FIRs against builders
Content:
This story is from January 5, 2020

Representative image

NEW DELHI: The Economic Offences Wing (EOW) of Delhi Police has registered 13 FIRs against a group of builders suspected to be involved in an alleged housing scam . Scores of buyers were allegedly offered “DDA flats under a central government scheme” in Dwarka .

TOI had first reported about the scam after which a Special Investigation Team was formed to look into the cases. Police suspect the role of Nigerian gangs operating from south and west Delhi to be involved in it.

The probe revealed that the builders attracted home buyers in various categories for investments in lucrative housing schemes through SMSes and online advertisements. The potential buyers were lured to pay a “development charge” to apply for the “DDA flats” after which the builders disappeared with the money.

“We are probing the role of some Nigerian gangs since the modus operandi is similar to some previous cases in which they were involved. We are taking the help of cyber experts to track down the source from which the messages were generated,” said OP Mishra, additional CP, EOW.

The builders had hired agencies to send bulk messages to the people in which they even provided a link to a website through which the application could be made and the money could be transferred. The fraudsters had created several web portals and social media groups. Nearly one lakh people have enrolled themselves through the website, the cops suspect. Rewant Kumar Mishra, a resident of Sangam Vihar, had earlier registered an FIR against Revanta Multi State CGHS LTD. Mishra said that in 2015, he had come across an advertisement that the company, located at Sector- 23, Dwarka, was going to build residential flats through landpooling in Dwarka’s L Zone.

After forming a society, the company had started urging people to invest in “Smart Residency”. The accused issued brochures and made various presentations citing the DDA-approved landpooling policy to lure investors. Mishra said he was allotted the membership of the society after investing Rs 20.2 lakh for a 1,760-sqft flat. The total cost was pegged at Rs 51.2 lakh. In March 2019, he was asked to pay another Rs 5.9 lakh.

The company said “the Development Ministry, Govt of India” had reduced the floor-area ratio from 400 to 200 due to scarcity of water and other resources. The complainant later came to know through media reports that DDA hadn’t announced any such scheme.

Police sources say that the matter had first come to fore before the DDA which had started its own enquiry. However, when the Authority came across a number of complaints, the matter was informed to Delhi Police. The EOW was subsequently asked to probe it.

Cases under sections of cheating, impersonation and forgery have been registered against the builders.

Title: Not allotted land for Mela, seers stop neta’s cavalcade
Content:
This story is from January 5, 2020

Deputy CM Keshav Prasad Maurya talks to protesting seers during a visit to the Magh Mela ground in Allahabad o... Read More

Allahabad: Irked over not being allotted land on the 2000-bigha venue, scores of seers blocked the way and refused to budge when deputy chief minister Keshav Prasad Maurya and his cavalcade tried to enter the Magh Mela premises on Saturday afternoon.

Most of the seers were associated with Sant Hitkarni Hriday Narayan Sewa Sansthan and other religious organisations. The deputy CM was in Allahabad to review preparations for Magh Mela.

Shouting slogans in front of the Mela Adhikari’s office, the seers alleged that they had not been allocated land on the Mela premises and that they had been staging a hunger strike near the Mela Adhikari’s office since the past three days.

The route was blocked for over 15 minutes. The protesters also claimed that Mela officials were least bothered to hear them out and address their grievances. They also said that if they weren’t allocated land soon enough, they would protest in front of chief minister’s official residence in Lucknow.

Saint Doodh Nath Shastri, who was among the protesting seers, alleged, “There are several irregularities in land allocation. Seers of many organisations like Shri Ram Chandra Sewa sansthan, Maa Sharda Shakti Peeth, Paramhans Shaikshanik Sewa Nyas had been staging a hunger strike since January 2. However, Mela officials didn’t approach them even once to get the issue sorted out.”

Another seer Amrit Lal from Hari Om Sewa Shivir said, “Here saints are being treated inhumanly, which would not be tolerated.” Before Mela police and district officials could do anything, Maurya himself stepped out of his car and assured the agitating saints that their grievances would be addressed. The agitating seers called off the protest after being assured by the deputy CM of quick action. The Magh Mela will start from January 10.

Title: Uzbek boy gets his voice back in Delhi
Content:
This story is from January 5, 2020

Ozotilla

NEW DELHI: An Uzbek national who had lost the ability to speak following a major accident regained his voice recently following reconstructive surgery conducted at a Delhi hospital .

Khusanbek Ozotilla fell from the terrace of his house, suffering critical head injuries, for which he underwent tracheostomy — a surgical procedure that involves creating an opening in the neck in order to place a tube into the windpipe — 10 years ago.

Since then, he has had to live with a hole in his neck due to which he lost his ability to speak, said Dr Suresh Singh Naruka, a consultant in the ENT department at Indraprastha Apollo Hospitals.

He added that Ozotilla couldn’t speak at all when he was brought to the hospital by his mother. “Childhood is all about talking, learning and exploring. However, Ozotilla was deprived of all these pleasures as he was unable to speak. After 10 years of not being able to communicate, his mother approached us,” the doctor said.

The child was admitted to the hospital on December 16. The surgery was planned to be executed in two stages.

In the first stage, Ozotilla underwent an endoscopic examination where his airway was found to be narrowed, a condition called subglottic stenosis.

After assessment, a T-tube was placed in his trachea, said Dr Ameet Kishore, senior consultant surgeon, ENT, at Indraprastha Apollo Hospitals.

After examination, it was decided that a reconstructive surgery would be carried out to correct the narrowed airway. This was technically challenging, Dr Kishore said.

“After seven days, the second-stage surgery was conducted. A proper reconstruction of his windpipe was conducted successfully using a part of his rib as a graft, thus making the windpipe wider. The operation enabled closing of the opening in the neck,” the doctor added.

“Finally, after 10 years of misery and suffering, the child can speak again. He has now returned home and is leading a normal life,” Dr Naruka said. “We are happy that he is able to speak now with clarity,” Dr Kishore said, adding that tracheostomy is more hazardous in children than in adults, and carries special risks in the young.

Title: Priyanka meets families affected by anti-CAA violence in M’nagar, Meerut
Content:
This story is from January 5, 2020

Meerut/Muzaffarnagar: Congress general secretary Priyanka Gandhi Vadra met families of victims of alleged “police excesses” and violence during protests against the amended Citizenship Act in Meerut and Muzaffarnagar districts of western Uttar Pradesh.

“Police have to protect the people, give them justice, but what has happened here is entirely opposite,” Priyanka Gandhi, who had earlier visited affected families in Lucknow and Bijnor, told reporters.

“I have written a letter to governor detailing on police brutalities. Innocent people were targeted without any reason. Police ransacked homes and assaulted people,” Gandhi said in Muzaffarnagar.

During her unscheduled visit to Muzaffarnagar, the Congress leader went to the residence of Maulana Asad Raza Hussaini in Kidwai Nagar and met the family. Hussaini, a renowned cleric who runs a madrassa-cum-orphanage, was picked up along with 39 other inmates of the orphanage and was brutally assaulted allegedly by the local police.

Speaking with TOI, cleric Hussaini’s son Mohammad Hussaini said, “She visited our house on Saturday morning and assured us that she is with us. We told her that the police had arrested 17 students of our madrassa. They have released only four students. We also told her how police had assaulted our students.”

Gandhi was accompanied by several local Congress leaders, including former Saharanpur MLA Imran Masood.

The Congress delegation later met the family of Noor Mohammed who was killed during the protests.

“It’s heart-wrenching. His wife who is seven months pregnant and has one-and-a-half-year-old daughter is left all alone,” she said.

“Wherever injustice has happened, we will stand by the people and help them in whatever way possible,” the Congress leader said.

Noor Mohammad,24, was killed during violence when he was returning home after purchasing medicine from Arya Samaj road in Muzaffarnagar for his daughter who was not keeping well.

She also met Ruqaiya Parveen, whose house was allegedly ransacked by the police.

The Congress leader said she has highlighted each and every “police excesses” in a lengthy memorandum to UP governor Anandiben Patel during her visit to the state last week.

“It has all the details of how police have assaulted people without any reason. If there is any wrongdoing, then police should take action. No one can object to it.

“But here the police are indulging in vandalism... the girl was about to get married in two days, she has 16 stitches (on her forehead),” she said.

Towards the afternoon, the delegation left for Meerut where police served the Congress leader a notice under section 144 of CrPC at Dadri police check post.

Earlier on December 24, UP Police had stopped Priyanka Gandhi and her brother and former Congress president Rahul Gandhi from entering Meerut town, citing prohibitory orders under section 144 of CrPC, as a result of which they had to return to Delhi without meeting the affected families.

However, this time, a meeting of Priyanka Gandhi with the families of the six victims who were killed in Meerut was arranged at the residence of a local NSUI leader.

Later, Meerut additional director general Prashant Kumar said, “She was not stopped in Meerut. Section 144 has already been promulgated and is still in force. The delegation was served a notice regarding this.”

Earlier, Priyanka had met the families of those killed in clashes in Bijnor.

On December 28, Priyanka Gandhi alleged that she was manhandled by police personnel when she tried to resist their attempts to stop her from visiting the Lucknow residence of retired IPS officer SR Darapuri, who was arrested in connection with the anti-CAA protests.

Later, the Congress leader met the family of party worker Sadaf Zafar and alleged that she was arrested on "baseless" charges by the police.

A Lucknow court on Saturday granted bail to Sadaf Jafar, Darapuri and 13 others arrested in connection with anti-CAA protests in Lucknow.

Title: Dileep’s discharge plea dismissed
Content:
This story is from January 5, 2020

Kochi: Additional special sessions court on Saturday dismissed the discharge petition filed by actor Dileep seeking to get his name removed from the accused list in the actress rape case.

The court also denied the request by his counsel seeking 10 days to file an appeal at higher courts before framing charges, citing the Supreme Court order to complete the trial in six months. The court has ordered that the framing of charges would be done on Monday.

The court found merit in the claims of the prosecution that there was prima facie evidence in the case and refused to allow the discharge petition at such an early stage.

“The court heard the arguments in the discharge petitions filed by eighth accused (Dileep) and tenth accused (Vishnu). The court found merit in the prosecution arguments and found that prima facie the charges against the accused stands. Hence,the discharge petition was dismissed. At this point anyway, it was not possible to go deep into the evidence but prima facie the court accepted the prosecution’s arguments,” said advocate A Sureshan, the special prosecutor.

Dileep was not present in court and applied permission for absence, which was granted. However, the court stated it as a last chance as Dileep kept away from court on most of the occasions. Prime accused Pulsar Suni was not produced in court as there was no escort available.

“The court has ordered that the charges against the accused would be framed on January 6 and directed that all accused should be present in court on the day without failure,” Sureshan said.

The counsel for Dileep requested 10 days’ time to approach higher court against the order, which was also denied. The court pointed out the Supreme Court direction to expedite the trial and complete it in six months and denied the requested time, in light of the SC order.

The court had on Wednesday heard Dileep’s counsel for over one hour behind closed doors on the petition as it contained sensitive details. After hearing Dileep’s counsel, the prosecution had objected over-discharging him from the case.

Meanwhile, the discharge petition filed by tenth accused Vishnu was also dismissed by the court. Both accused can challenge the court’s order at higher courts. However, the appeal for discharging them from the case has to be filed before the framing of charges in the case, sources said.

The case refers to the incident on February 17, 2017 in which a female actor was sexually assaulted in a moving car, and the visuals of the crime recorded.

Actor Dileep, was arrested in connection with the case on July 10, 2017 after the preliminary chargesheet was filed. After his arrest, he was charged with rape for conspiring with the prime accused Pulsar Suni for committing the crime.

Title: Mathematician KSS Namboodiripad dead
Content:
This story is from January 5, 2020

Thiruvananthapuram: Renowned Mathematician KSS Namboodiripad died here on Saturday. He was 84.

Namboodiripad, who was suffering from age-related ailments, breathed his last at his residence at Komana, Thrippadapuram, on Saturday evening. His mortal remains were taken to his ancestral home at Puttumanoor in Tripunithura by late night and cremation will take place there on Sunday.

Komanamana Sankaranarayanan Subramanian Namboodiripad, popularly known as KSSN in academic circles, had retired as the professor and head of department of Mathematics, Kerala University, in 1995.

Namboodiripad was a pioneering researcher in semi groups and modern algebra. He had several axioms and theorems to his credit, apart from hundreds of research papers published in international journals. Namboodiripad’s PhD thesis was published in Memoirs of American Mathematical Society, a dream achievement for Mathematics researchers.

KSSN was a diehard proponent of free and open software. He was an expert in GNU/Linux and TeX, which is a leading software used for digitising mathematical and technical research. In 1990s, Namboodiripad introduced TeX software to researchers here.

“Never ever in his life, KSSN has used Windows or any other proprietary operating system except for a brief period when DOS was the sole operating system for personal computers. ,” remembers C V Radhakrishan, a technopreneur who had closely associated with Namboodiripad.

“His most important contribution to Mathematics is in the field of semi groups. Only a very few in our country had the rare honour of being recognised by American Mathematical Society. Mathematicians from different parts of the world used to visit him here till he fell ill,” said A R Rajan, director of Encyclopaedic Research Institute. Rajan had been a long-term colleague of Namboodiripad in the University.

Namboodiripad leaves behind wife Priyadatha T N, son K S Ajan, daughter Priyadarsini K S, daughter-in-law Luciya Rodrigues and son-in-law Jithesh P Joseph. His elder son K S Manu had died.

Title: Action against PSI ordered for faulty probe
Content:
This story is from January 5, 2020

Vadodara: A local court has ordered the city police commissioner to take departmental action against a woman sub-inspector for a faulty and discriminatory investigation in a 2017 case.

The case pertains to the demolition of hutments at Bhathujinagar slums near Vrundavan crossroads where accused were booked for causing damage to property and assault at Panigate police station in December 2017.

The court of additional judicial magistrate S P Dave has asked the top cop to also inform the court about the action taken against sub-inspector N D Mir within 60 days. Mir is currently posted in the police control room at Police Bhavan.

As the investigating officer of the case, Mir did not take into consideration the role of the man who had hired the two convicts to demolish the hutments nor did she seize the vehicle which was used for the purpose. As per the case details, the two convicts Rakesh alias Lallu Kahar and Rahul Kahar had demolished some huts including their own as they were hired allegedly by former heavyweight councillor from Waghodiya Road Harshit alias Gopi Talati.

In her complaint to Panigate police, one of hut owners, Geeta Jadav, stated that the duo had demolished the huts on Talati’s directions as the slum land was owned by him.

Mir took statements of eye-witnesses and other witnesses, but did not get into the depth of the case where Talati’s role could come to the fore. During the hearing of the case, Mir was also summoned where she admitted that she did not try to find out who had hired the two convicts and did not even try to find out the owner of the land where the demolition took place.

On Friday, the court sentenced the duo to one year of imprisonment and fined them of Rs 10,000 each.

Title: GFP: Unsure on polls, keen to encourage young faces
Content:
This story is from January 5, 2020

Panaji: GFP has yet to decide whether the party will contest the coming Zilla Panchayat (ZP) elections along party lines or offer support to candidates close to the party’s MLAs. GFP president Vijai Sardesai said the party was in favour of encouraging younger faces in politics, but would take the final decision after the government officially notifies the ZP elections.

ZP elections are slated to be held in March.

“Our MLA Jayesh Salgaonkar says there is a consensus view that the lower tier of democracy should not be politicised. This is a view that is predominant in Goa and that is why even the last time, the Congress did not contest on party lines,” Sardesai said, while speaking to the press at the party office after a meeting of all the office bearers.

Sources say the party is a bit wary about contesting ZP elections on party lines given that GFP was once a party of the ruling dispensation in the state and remains an ally of the NDA.

Meanwhile, Congress has clearly stated that this time they are ready to contest the elections on the party symbol, a break from its earlier stand that grassroots politics should be isolated from party affiliations.

According to Sardesai, a significant section of the BJP legislative wing does not want to contest on party lines. “Some of them feel they cannot afford to take the symbol in their constituency,” Sardesai said, hinting at MLAs who recently broke away from Congress to join BJP.

Title: Goa: No protests, public meets, on January 7
Content:
This story is from January 5, 2020

Representative image

PANAJI: In view of the a one-day special assembly session to be held on January 7 , the North Goa superintendent of police has issued an order prohibiting public meetings and people convening or collecting as an assembly, taking out any procession or staging any demonstration on the road, street or thoroughfare in the jurisdiction of Porvorim and Panaji .

The prohibition will be enforced till the assembly session ends. “Anyone intending to convene or collect such assembly will have to apply for permission,” a press note states.

Title: Gujarat ranked best state for startups
Content: GANDHINAGAR: Gujarat was ranked the “best performing state” ranking in the 100th percentile in the National Startup Ranking for 2018, according to a recent report of NASSCOM and Zinnov, a consulting firm.The report states, “Gujarat has done remarkably well across all seven pillars of assessment, such as incubation support, seed funding support, institutional support, simplified regulations, easing public procurement, awareness and outreach and venture funding support, compared to the national average.”The current number of nodal institutions/startup incubators, which have been promoting the growth of startups under the state government scheme is 33. They have been instrumental in supporting growth of more than 236 operational startups in the state. These startups span pharmacology , medicines, surgical, geology, healthtech, food and nutrition, nutraceuticals, envirotech and solutions addressing many modern-day ecological issues.

Title: Greens back on platter as supply up, rates down 50%
Content:
This story is from January 5, 2020

Indore: A surge in vegetable supply has calmed down prices of greens ruling high for over a month giving some respite to common man.

Vegetable supplies have almost doubled from nearby villages of Indore in past week dampening prices for most green vegetables.

Farooque Raeen, a wholesale vegetable supplier from Indore said, “Supplies of vegetables from local villages have risen sharply in past over a week and this has dampened prices. Vegetable prices are expected to remain down to steady for in near term as supplies look smooth.”

Indore is getting fresh vegetable supplies from villages of Nimar, Barwani, Sanwer and Mhow among other areas.

Prices of most vegetables have fallen over 50 per cent in the wholesale market, said traders.

Prolonged and heavy rain this season had led vegetable prices soaring disturbing household budget of common man after rains damaged a large chuck of vegetables in the region and blocked transportation of greens to local mandis.

In past months, vegetables from Maharashtra, Gujarat and Uttar Pradesh were sold in the local market to meet demand.

Abdul Rais, a green vegetable dealer at Choithram market said, “Earlier dependency was on outstation and cold storage supply to meet the demand but with fresh arrivals from nearby villages market is back to normal.”

Prices of onions have also dropped significantly in the wholesale market to Rs 40 per kg to Rs 45 per kg after making a record high of Rs 105 per kg, traders said.

In greens, most vegetables bottle gourd, sponge gourd and capsicum have fallen excluding tomato amid a major loss to the crop.

In the wholesale market, tomato is trading at Rs 15 per kg to Rs 18 per kg, traders said.

Title: Answer sheets of toppers not uploaded yet
Content:
This story is from January 5, 2020

Agra: Even after two months of its convocation ceremony, Dr Bhimrao Ambedkar University administration has not been able to upload answer sheets of meritorious students on the official website. University administration had claimed that answer sheets of students awarded medals for academic performances will be uploaded on the website after the convocation ceremony which took place on October 11.

University administration had adopted the ‘best practice’ of uploading answer sheets of toppers on its website in 2017. The answer sheets of meritorious students were uploaded on the website in 2018. The move was aimed to bring in transparency. Besides, it also gave a chance to common students to see how toppers answer the questions and learn how to achieve high scores.

A BA final year student said, “The evaluation of answer sheets was completed in June. In more than six months, the university administration has not been able to upload copies of meritorious students on the website. We asked our teachers about this but they were not able to offer any valid answer. We are curious to know what the toppers did differently.”

University public relation officer GS Sharma said, “We are in the process of uploading the answer sheets of meritorious students on varsity website. The work will be completed by January end. We are also trying to put video clips of meritorious students providing useful tips to their juniors.”

Title: Kerala: Crime Branch seeks nod to prosecute Maradu ex-president
Content:
This story is from January 5, 2020

KA Devassy

KOCHI: Crime Branch (CB) has sought permission from local self-government department (LSGD) to prosecute former president of Maradu panchayat KA Devassy , who is the present opposition leader of Maradu municipality in cases registered against the illegal apartment complexes at Maradu.

After the controversy arose, Devassy said that he had no role in the issue and those who approved the plan are responsible for the present problem. “I have received no information about anyone taking action (against me). I don’t know anything about this case,” he said, responding to CB’s move.

However, a CB officer said that they approached LSG department three weeks ago seeking permission to arraign him in the case and initiate prosecution measures. “We are awaiting a response from LSGD. We will summon him for interrogation and initiate prosecution measures once we receive the permission,” said a source with the investigation team.

Sources said that CB has already collected evidence against the former president and plans to complete its investigation in coming months. CB has questioned over 100 persons as part of the probe, including 22 former panchayat members. However, sleuths were able to collect statements of only 250 apartment owners as the rest were unavailable.

CB is investigating three cases in connection with the construction of H2O Holy Faith, Alpha Serene and Jain Coral Cove based on the petition by apartment owners. The cases were transferred from to CB from local police stations.

As many as four accused, including builder Sandeep Mehta, were arraigned in the case of Jain Coral Cove. Five, including builder Paul Raj and the architect who drew the plan, were named accused in the case of Alpha Serene. Four, including builder Sani Francis, were named accused in the case of H20 Holy Faith.

Former panchayat secretary Mohammed Ashraf, former Maradu panchayat junior superintendent PE Joseph and former UD clerk in Maradu panchayat Jayaram Naik were accused in the three cases.

Sani Francis, Paul Raj, Mohammed Ashraf, PE Joseph and Jayram Naik were arrested and later released on bail. Sandeep Mehta is yet to be traced.

Title: Maradu flats: Countdown to demolition begins
Content:
Aerial view of the Golden Kayaloram flat complex which is to be demolished following Supreme Court order in Ma... Read More

KOCHI: People will not be allowed to gather within a 200m radius of the apartment complexes that will be demolished in Maradu as the district administration will impose CrPC Section 144 during demolition on January 11 and 12. Prohibitory orders, which will be in effect from 9am, will be revoked once officials concerned inform the district administration that the place is safe for people to return.To ensure law and safety, around 500 policemen will be deployed at the boundary of each exclusion zone that would be marked with red flags.Evacuation of people from houses near the apartment complexes will start at 8.30am on January 11. There will be pick up points for transporting residents to shelter points. Senior citizens will get special attention.At 10.30am, the first siren will be given and it will last one minute. This is to warn people and ensure that nobody is left inside exclusion zone. A police team will then search the exclusion zone. At 10.55am another one-minute siren will alert motorists and all traffic movement on major roads will be stopped. Then five minutes prior to the blasting another siren will be sounded as a warning.To ensure safety cover for police personnel posted at the boundary of the exclusion zone, siren will be blown till the blasting process is over. A 30 second-long siren will be blown to indicate the building has been cleared after the entry of demolition agency members.Later, fire tenders and structural engineers will enter the spot to assess safety of nearby structures. A report will be submitted to the control room by structural engineers about the condition of the structures.A mock drill will be conducted in the area on January 10 to clear suspicion and fear in the minds of residents. Police will identify vantage points for public to watch the implosion. Traffic diversion will be put in place during the implosion.

Title: B’lureans decry, support CAA in protests across city
Content:
This story is from January 5, 2020

Activists display postcards they’ve written to the Supreme Court demanding repeal CAA at Freedom Park on Satur... Read More

Title: Don’t give religious colour to anti-CAA protests: Kerala Nadvathul Mujahideen
Content:
This story is from January 5, 2020

A protest rally against CAA-NRC in Thiruvananthapuram on Saturday

KOZHIKODE: Kerala Nadvathul Mujahideen (KNM) has cautioned against the attempts of “certain vested interests” to smuggle in organizational interests in the agitations against Citizenship Amendment Act (CAA) and National Register of Citizens (NRC).

The meeting of the state leaders of the KNM held here on Saturday felt that religious organizations have the duty to convince the society that the content of the anti-CAA agitations is secular.

A statement issued after the meeting exhorted those taking part in the agitation not to give any religious colour to the protests. “The agitation should not be used as an opportunity to strengthen any organization. We should be wary of the attempts to confine the citizenship issue as the problem of a community,” the statement said.

KNM believes that the Union government is more afraid of the secular content of the agitation. “The slogans that are intended as protest against the divisive forces should not be the ones that help such forces indirectly,” the statement said, adding that it is really noteworthy that women in large numbers are reacting against “the draconian law”.

The meeting also condemned the arrest and detention of those are protesting against CAA. The meeting called on all sections of the people to join the agitations, sinking party affiliations. “The directions given by the Muslim Co-ordination Committee to those participating in the agitations should followed by everyone,” the statement said.

It is learnt that the KNM raised the concern on communalizing the protests after it noticed that some organizations are trying to draw political mileage from the agitations. There are suspicions that these outfits are trying to further their own agenda through the protests. The Muslim Co-ordination Committee issued a direction to block such attempts.

KNM state president T P Abdulla Koya Madani inaugurated the meeting. General secretary M Muhammad Madani, Hussein Madavoor, H E Muhammad Babu Sait, Noor Muhammad Noorha, Swalahudeen Madani, M I Abdul Majeed Swalahi and others attended meeting.

Title: Help in hand for small and micro business
Content:
This story is from January 5, 2020

Harshvardhan Lunia

Title: Spurned youth uses 108 service to deliver ‘revenge’
Content:
This story is from January 5, 2020

Caption

Vadodara: A 40-year-old mother of two girls was embarrassed beyond limits when for the umpteenth time she had to send away paramedical staff of 108 GVK-EMRI from her doorstep after they had been sent there to ‘deliver her daughter’s baby’!

The horrifying prank had already happened for over two dozen times in the past one month and the woman was tired of the unnecessary harassment. For, not only was her unmarried daughter not pregnant, but also that the mischief monger was a 22-year-old youth, Praveen alias Ashwin Rawal, who wanted a romantic relationship with the much-married woman!

When she rejected Rawal’s advances, he made the prank calls to the ambulance service and rush the paramedical staff to her house.

Finally, she could take it no more and lodged a complaint against him at Nandesari police station. Cops arrested Rawal, an unemployed youth living at Angadh, for harassment, sending obscene messages and intimidating the woman.

According to the case details, Rawal had been messaging the woman for a year tryibng to woo her into having a fling with him. “He even used to call her when she ignored his messages and spurned his proposals. Upset at the rejection, Rawal sought revenge and started sending obscene text messages on her WhatsApp threatening her of dire consequences,” said the police.

Lately, the accused also started sending messages to people living in Nandesari village which irked the villagers and some were contemplating to settle the score with him their way, cops said.

When 108 ambulances started visitng the woman’s house frequently for about 20 times in a month, it created a buzz in the village after which the woman and her husband approached the police. Cops investigated the call records to the emergency services and found it to be from Rawal.

“Many from his village too had complaints against him when we went to arrest the accused,” an official said. He was produced before a judicial magistrate’s court on Friday and sent to Vadodara Central Jail as he did not seek bail, cops added.

Title: CAT 2019: 200 students from city score above 98 percentile
Content:
This story is from January 5, 2020

Around 2,000 students from Vadodara had appeared for the exam

Vadodara: Hailing from the tribal town of Dahod, Karan Dasani had made his parents proud last year. Karan graduated in mechanical engineering stream from Vallabh Vidyanagar’s Birla Vishwakarma Mahavidyalaya with a gold medal.

On Saturday, too, the Dahod-based Dasani family had a reason to celebrate, as Karan scored 99.95 percentile after the results of the Common Admission Test (CAT) 2019 for admission into management courses of the Indian Institutes of Management (IIMs) were declared.

“I have always worked hard to prove that even a kid from a tribal town can score well in academics,” said Karan, who is expecting calls from IIM-Ahmedabad, IIM-Calcutta and IIM-Lucknow.

“My priority will also be in that order,” said Karan, whose father Damodardas is a lawyer, while mother Heena is a homemaker.

“I had been preparing for a year for the CAT. I had committed a small blunder during the exam but later corrected it. The result is a tad lower than my expectation, but it is still decent enough,” said Dasani, who wants to make a career in investment banking.

Shilp Bhalodia, who completed his BTech from Pandit Deendayal Petroleum University, on the other hand secured 99.94 percentile. Shilp, whose father Yogesh is also an electrical engineer like him, is expecting calls from IIM-Ahmedabad, IIM-Bangalore and IIM-Calcutta.

“I will try to get into any of these institutes or else opt for Faculty of Management Studies, Delhi,” said Shilp, whose mother Meena is a housewife.

Around 2,000 students from the city had appeared in CAT 2019 exam. Nearly 200 students from the city have scored percentile above 98.

Among those who appeared in the exam included trainers and directors of private coaching institutes who sat for the test with the motive to keep themselves updated and set an example for their students.

Title: Smaller Metro stations to keep mega project on track
Content:
This story is from January 5, 2020

Jaipur: Metro stations, which will be constructed under the Jaipur Metro Phase-II (proposed between Sitapura and Ambabari), will not be lavish and spacious as the existing ones.

To make the project financially viable, the Jaipur Metro Rail Corporation (JMRC) has proposed to construct small structures, which would occupy less area and need less funds.

The decision was taken after taking a cue from Delhi and Chennai. A senior JMRC official said, “In the revised detailed project report (DPR), we have proposed to construct smaller stations to reduce costs. The complete DPR of the project with revised costs will be received by mid-February.”

In the detailed project report (DPR) prepared in 2014, it was mentioned that the project required land worth Rs 875 crore and construction costs to the tune of Rs 9,500 crore. Aware of the fact that cost escalation can derail the project, JMRC and DMRC officials are trying to find out ways and means to reduce the cost. These include rationalisation of the construction and outsourcing.

A Delhi Metro Rail Corporation (DMRC) official informed that not only Jaipur, there are many cities where rationalisation method has been adopted while constructing new Metro projects. There are a few ways including reducing width of the viaduct by 15%, cutting down length of metro stations, reducing size of the two metro rail depots and outsourcing fare collection system.

An official said, “It is not necessary all the methods can be applied for cost cutting in Jaipur. We would examine ways to make the project financially viable.”

The state will seek financial assistance from the Centre to construct the Phase-II corridor. Both the Centre and the state would invest 50-50% to develop the project.

After the change in regime, hope of launching the phase-II project has revived as Metro was the pet project of chief minister Ashok Gehlot in his previous tenure. The JMRC prepared its first DPR in 2011 during the Congress government’s tenure. However, the project has not seen the light of day even after seven years.

To reduce costs, the corporation has proposed to construct an elevated corridor on major part of the route. This would cut down the construction cost drastically as it is estimated that elevated corridor requires Rs 200 crore per km. The construction cost goes up to Rs 550 crore per km underground.

Title: Kerala: Government exemptions could hurt implementation says corporation
Content:
This story is from January 5, 2020

Representative image

THIRUVANANTHAPURAM: The state government’s ban on single-use plastic products is failing to provide traction to the civic body’s implementation efforts, leaving many questions unanswered. The corporation’s health wing is suddenly faced with an influx of plastic carry bags labelled ‘compostable’ in the wake of the exemption granted by the state government.

The government has exempted products made from compostable plastic bearing the label ‘compostable’ and conforming to IS/ISO 17088:2008. Corporation officials are at a loss trying to distinguish between ‘compostable’ and banned plastics.

The rules define compostable plastic as one that undergoes degradation by biological processes during composting to yield CO2, water, inorganic compounds and biomass at a rate consistent with other known compostable materials, excluding conventional petro-based plastics, and does not leave visible, distinguishable or toxic residue.

In 2009, the Central Pollution Control Board (CPCB) sponsored a study by Central Institute of Plastics Engineering & Technology (Cipet), Chennai for identification and evaluation of performance of biodegradable polymers in India with reference to its biodegradability under laboratory scale composting conditions as per ASTM D-6400 and IS/ISO 17088:2008.

Benefits and effects were equally analysed in the study. It was noted that promoting biodegradable plastics will increase India’s overall plastic consumption and it was opined that the major cause of concern would be to segregate between non-biodegradable and biodegradable plastics in the waste stream. The study recommended that introduction of biodegradable plastics would be helpful only if proper “eco-labelling” and “plastics coding” systems are implemented. As per the standards, biodegradable plastic should attain 60% degradation in a period of 45 days. Only a few samples tested during the study could record degradation rate of 60-67% while the other samples could only attain 4-41%.

It is this level of degradation which is posing a trouble for the corporation. While a PCB official says that sellers of compostable plastic need to obtain a registration from CPCB, the corporation is more concerned about how such a large quantity of compostable plastic could be subjected to degradation. “We are planning to collect details on suppliers of compostable plastic and the quantity being supplied by them. With regard to promised levels of degradation they have to be made accountable,’’ said a corporation official.

The exemption on disposable cups of a certain category also worries the civic body. As per the first order of the state government, all plastic-coated cups, plates, paper bags and paper bowls were banned. However, later paper cups using water-based coated sheets, which are 100% biodegradable, were exempted, following a high court order.

The study concluded that the compostable bags meeting ASTM D-5338 or IS/ISO 17088:2008 standards will degrade in a compost environment but may not break down in ambient environment. Therefore, it can be concluded that biodegradable or compostable plastics may not be a better option, it pointed out.

Mohammad Siddique, vice-president of the Kerala Vyapari Vyavasayi Ekopana Samithi, said authorities are making undue haste in implementing the ban and that it could result in enormous economic loss for merchants.

Title: Three auto-lifters held, bikes seized
Content:
This story is from January 5, 2020

Allahabad: Three auto-lifters were arrested near Mariadeeh road under Dhoomanganj police station while they were planning to take looted car and bikes for resale to Kaushambi.

The robbers were identified as Imran of Pratapgarh, Shahil Ahmad of Faizabad and Vinay Kumar alias Chhotu of Prayagraj.

Two looted bikes were also recovered.

Inspector (Dhoomanganj) Sanjay Kumar Singh told reporters that a group of robbers had looted a cab from the driver near Lord Ayyappa Temple road three days ago.

“On a tip-off that a gang of robbers were planning to take a looted car and two bikes to Kaushambi for resale, Dhooman ganj police swung into action and nabbed all the three robbers,” said the inspector.

He added that those arrested were professional robbers and members of an inter-district gang that used to target cabs and taxis.

Soon after the loots, the gang used to change the original registration plate of the taxi and resale it with forged documents, said police.

“We are looking for two more members of the gang including—Aman Rajput and Kadar, residents of Ramman Ka Pura,” added police.

Title: GFP wants end to tourism road shows
Content:
This story is from January 5, 2020

Panaji: GFP on Saturday said that the tourism department’s road shows have failed to improve Goa’s tourism sector and only served as “picnics” for the tourism minister ’s family. It also demanded that such road shows be banned.

Blaming the government for the slide in Goa’s tourism sector, GFP president Vijai Sardesai resurrected his “scum of the earth” jibe. “Today, the scum of the earth are getting a red carpet and we call it tourism. Our party’s clear stance is that tourism has reduced purely because of the government,” Sardesai said. “Our clear-cut demand is that there should be a ban on the road shows organised by the tourism department. Road shows are nothing but picnics organised for the tourism minister and his family,” he added.

Title: Agra University sends notice to 84 colleges for failing to provide info on BEd scam
Content:
This story is from January 5, 2020

Dr Bhimrao Ambedkar University

AGRA: As many as 84 colleges affiliated to Dr Bhimrao Ambedkar University here have been issued notice for failing to provide information relating to the 2004-5 B.Ed scam. According to university officials, the affiliation of these colleges may get cancelled.

The management of these colleges have been asked to provide evidence of the number of approved seats, students enrolled for the B.Ed session for 2004-5, fee received, students who appeared in the exam and details of results of the candidates among other things.

On December 28, Agra University had released a list of 4,704 fake, tempered and duplicate B.Ed certificates of the 2004-05 session. The list was originally prepared by Allahabad High Court-monitored special investigation team (SIT) probing the B.Ed scam at Agra University.

The list contains names of candidates of 84 affiliated colleges in Agra and Aligarh divisions. Details have been sought from these colleges to check their role in alleged malpractices.

Varsity officials said the documents and details provided by these colleges will be verified. Those found involved in the malpractices will lose their affiliation.

According to sources, the list of 84 colleges include three private institutions which did not have the affiliation to run a B.Ed course. But marksheets were issued on the name of these colleges.

The names of the candidates with fake or duplicate certificates have been uploaded on the university website. They were shown as having passed with a first division. A majority of them had scored around 70% marks in the practical examination. The candidates had secured up to 191 marks out of 200.

Investigations revealed that some of them were close relatives of college owners.

University registrar KN Singh said, “Notices have been issued to the colleges, asking them to provide documents and details relating to B.Ed session of 2004-05. The response made by the colleges will be verified. Strict action will be taken against the colleges found involved in malpractices. Their affiliation will be cancelled.”

Earlier, the candidates with their names in the list were required to provide a report, including details on 17 points and a clarification concerning the authenticity of their B.Ed degree within 15 days. So far, no candidate has provided a clarification or details sought by the university administration.

B.Ed session 2004-05 allegedly witnessed major malpractices. Hundreds of fake marksheets were issued by over 80 self-financed colleges. During the investigation, SIT found that marks in over 2,000 marksheets were more than those awarded in the answersheets. In these cases, marks were increased after the evaluation process.

The alleged scam came to light in 2010 when a Mainpuri student, Sunil Kumar, who got second division in B.Ed and applied for another copy of the mark sheet at the university, was handed a first division result. He filed a complaint in the high court against the university. In 2014, the court formed the SIT to probe the matter.

Title: Man shot at near Bijnor RTO office by 2 bike-borne assailants
Content:
This story is from January 5, 2020

Representative image

BIJNOR: A man was shot at by bike-borne assailants near the Road Transport Office in the district on Saturday morning. A property dispute is said to be the cause of the attack.

Witnesses said bike-borne assailants waylaid Pravesh Kumar, 35, and opened fired at him. He was hit by a bullet on the hand. He was later referred to a higher facility in Meerut . He is said to be out of danger.

Kumar is a resident of mohalla Kassawan in Bijnor city. He sits near the RTO office and does the work of filling up forms of applicants. He was on way to the RTO office when the two bike-borne assailants shot at him. He fell and shouted for help. Passerby came to his rescue and informed police.

Kumar was first admitted to the district hospital and later, referred to Meerut.

On being asked about the matter, SP (city) Lakshmi Nivas Mishra said, “The family members of the victim have alleged that Pravesh was shot at over a land dispute by two persons. A probe is on.”

Title: 25 plus from Ahmedabad bell the CAT
Content:
Two top spots, however, have been claimed by BCom students

AHMEDABAD: More than 25 students from the city secured a place in the top 1% of the 2.44 lakh aspirants for the Common Admission Test (CAT) conducted by the IIMs for admissions. The results were declared on Saturday, putting some 2,440 candidates from across India in fierce competition to secure admissions at the top management institutes of the country.Our result has improved over the years with more candidates aspirants and better preparation, said Manish Shah, the Ahmedabad centre manager of a coaching class franchise. He said those who stuck to the formula and gave adequate weight to all sections scored better as pattern did not change much from 2019.“One decade ago, only a few students from Gujarat made it to the top IIMs but in the past three years alone, we have seen city students secure admission at IIM Ahmedabad,” said Shah. “It is due to better prepared students who are coming from all disciplines and are not limited to engineering.”The 99ers — those in the 99th percentile — however, were dominated by engineering students from IIT Gandhinagar , PDPU, DAIICT and Nirma University among others. Two top spots, however, have been claimed by BCom students.The representation of girls’ has remained low. Of 22 students at Shah’s centre, only two were girls.

Title: Auto-rickshaw driver attempts to commit suicide outside SSP office
Content:
This story is from January 5, 2020

Agra: An auto-rickshaw driver attempted to commit suicide outside the office of the SSP on Saturday by pouring inflammable liquid on himself. He though was rescued by policemen on duty, who reacted promptly.

Identified as Satyendra Singh Jadaun, resident of Kalandi Vihar of Itmad-ud-Daula, the man claimed local police had failed to arrest five men against whom he had lodged an FIR in October for brutal assault and money extortion.

“The men continue to harass me even after I met the SSP, the SP (city) and other cops several times, pleading that they be arrested. But no action was taken,” said Jadaun.

Jadaun was taken to Nai Ki Mandi police station and booked for breach of peace. SHO Sanjay Kumar Tyagi said, “His allegations are being probed by the SHO of Itmad-ud-Daula police station. He was booked under CrPc 151 because he created nuisance at the collectorate, but was later granted bail.”

Title: At Bar association convention in Bijnor, issues of HC bench takes centre stage
Content:
This story is from January 5, 2020

Bijnor: Presidents of bar associations of at least 22 districts in western UP came under one roof on Saturday to attend a convention in Bijnor where they a passed a resolution, demanding a separate high court (HC) bench in Meerut.

Addressing the convention, chairman of UP’s Bar Council, Hari Shankar Singh backed the demand of lawyers, who are seeking HC bench for west UP for almost 55 years.

“I will make an appointment from Prime Minister Narendra Modi when he visits Varanasi, and will bring a delegation of the members of the action committee to put a demand for a separate bench for west UP. I am ready to help the lawyers at all level,” Singh said,

Presiding over the programme, president of central action committee for west UP high court bench, Mange Ram, said, “When Maharashtra with a population of 11.42 crores can have three benches, why not west UP.”

Elaborating their strategy, Ram said, “We have decided to raise an awareness campaign to make people aware about the importance of having a high court bench in western UP, so that they can join our stir. Therefore, we have decided to put up awareness banners, posters and hoardings at the collectorate and other public places.”

The convention was organized under the supervision of Bijnor association president SK Babali and secretary Navdeep Singh at the district bar association hall, in which lawyers raised their local demands as well.

Representatives from all the parties were invited to the convention. Three MPs, two from BSP and one from SP, did not turn up for the event. Whereas SP MLA Manoj Paras and RLD leaders attended it.

Talking to TOI, former present of district bar association, Praveen Singh Dehswal, said, “This is a 55-year-old demand. People are tired of travelling over 550km to reach to Prayagraj and Lucknow for their hearings. Over 50 % of the total cases go to high court from western UP. Lawyers of HC oppose our movement and fear of losing their big chunk of clients. We have been getting assurances from the past and the present government, but could not proceed forward. This time, we have the same party ruling at the state and Centre. They should heed to the grievances of the people of west UP.”

Last month, Meerut MP Rajendra Agrawal had raised the issue in Lok Sabha and advocated resolution to form a HC bench in western UP. At that time he said, “The justice is right of common men. Where will he go? UP government had recommended a bench in 1955, but the advocates of the high court always exert pressure not to allow bench here in western UP. In fact, there should be three benches in UP, considering the state’s huge population.”

Replying to this, Union law and justice minister, Ravi Shankar Prashad told the house that a bench in western UP was possible only after a recommendation from the full bench of high court coupled with the infrastructure to house it.

Title: VMC seals 123 properties to recover tax
Content:
This story is from January 5, 2020

Vadodara: The Vadodara Municipal Corporation (VMC) sealed 123 commercial properties across the city on Saturday to recover long pending civic taxes.

According to VMC sources, those holding possession of most of the sealed properties paid up the pending dues by Friday evening. They added that the tax for the remaining properties was also expected soon.

Sources added that the process of recovery of taxes by way of disconnecting drainage and sewerage lines in residential properties would begin from next week.

VMC is looking to begin the process only in the West and North zone where tax bills were issued in time. The bills in the eastern and southern parts of the city were distributed late this year due to floods as well as drinking water woes in these areas.

Title: Priyanka and Rahul sparked violence: Shah
Content:
This story is from January 5, 2020

New Delhi: BJP national president Amit Shah on Sunday accused Delhi chief minister Arvind Kejriwal and Congress leaders Rahul Gandhi and Priyanka Vadra of “misleading” people on Citizenship Amendment Act (CAA) and “instigating” violence during the anti-CAA protests.

The Union home minister tried to assure Muslims that the new law had no provision of taking away the citizenship of minorities.

In a clear indication that BJP would make CAA one of its poll agendas for the Delhi assembly elections, Shah launched a door-to-door campaign in south Delhi’s Lajpat Nagar, which is largely inhabited by people who migrated from Pakistan after partition, to drum up support for the new Act. He visited eight houses, a jhuggi and a temple and distributed pamphlets explaining the features of CAA.

Shah’s visit also witnessed protests with a couple of girls shouting “We reject CAA” and putting up posters with “Shame NRC” and “Azaadi” written on them.

Addressing booth-level workers at IGI Stadium earlier, Shah said the opposition leaders were spreading “lies” about CAA and asked partymen to carry out an intensive campaign to inform the masses about its features.

“Kejriwal misled people. Congress, especially Rahul Gandhi and Priyanka Gandhi Vadra, misled people and instigated riots. I want to ask people if they want a government in Delhi that instigates riots due to its vote-bank politics,” Shah said.

Referring to a recent attack on Gurdwara Nankana Sahib by a mob in Pakistan, Shah asked opposition leaders to “open their eyes” to the atrocities against minorities in the neighbouring country. “This is an answer to all those opposing CAA. Tell me, if the Sikhs who were attacked at Gurdwara Nankana Sahib will not come to India, then where they will go?” he asked.

Calling Kejriwal and Gandhis “anti-Dalits” for opposing the amended Act, Shah said its beneficiaries were largely Dalits and the poor. “The Prime Minister came up with CAA. It was approved by the Cabinet and Parliament passed it,” he said.

The BJP leader also claimed that Priyanka Gandhi Vadra had extended her support to rioters by saying that she would visit the houses of those who had carried out the riots. He asked people to give missed calls to a toll free number put out by BJP to show their support to CAA. He also slammed the rumours that the number belonged to a video streaming website.

Title: IIT-Roorkee student attempts suicide
Content:
This story is from January 5, 2020

Representative image

DEHRADUN: An IIT-Roorkee MTech student attempted suicide at his hostel room on Saturday.

The student is currently undergoing treatment.

In a note, which was recovered from his room, the student said that noone had forced him to take the extreme step and it was his own decision.

Talking to TOI, Roorkee police station’s officer Amarjeet Singh said that the police was called by the IIT administration after some friends of the student saw (through a window) that he was lying in an unconscious state on the floor of his hostel room.

“The police reached at the spot and broke the door of the room where we recovered a suicide note,” said Singh. The official added that the parents of the student have been informed about the incident.

Following the incident, a statement was also released by the dean of students' welfare at IIT-R which read, “A Master's student was found unconscious in his hostel room today morning. The institute has informed the student’s parents and the police about the incident. The boy was immediately hospitalised and the institute is extending full support for the medical attention required. The student is recovering and is under medical observation.”According to a written response submitted by the HRD ministry in Parliament last year, IITs and IIMs saw 60 student suicides in the last five years. The 23 IITs accounted for 50 student suicides and the 20 IIMs witnessed 10 student suicides.

Title: Woman among three arrestedfor burglary
Content:
This story is from January 5, 2020

Allahabad: Police have busted an inter district burglars gang and arrested three key members including a woman near Gau Ghat, New Yamuna bridge road here on Saturday.

The police have also seized Rs 1.12 lakh cash, 1.10 kg ganja, four gold rings, one gold chain and other silver ornaments from their possession.

The arrested robbers were identified as Deepak Kumar, Lala and Neelam, residents of Tarbagh, Katghar and Malviya Nagar respectively.

SP (city) Brijesh Kumar Srivastava said, “Arrested woman Neelam, wife of Dinesh and resident of Malviya Nagar in Allahabad used to recce areas to create a plan for the loot.

SP further added that police have been looking for three more members of the gang including the kingpin. The gang in order to dodge police often changes its modus operandi and operational areas. The woman member of the gang, posing herself a labour or vendor, usually visited posh and dense populated locations and recce the spots where male members were asked to strike.

SP said the gang confessed to have executed over two dozen thefts and burglaries across the region. They used to target either jewellery shops or houses

Meanwhile, a joint team of crime branch and Daraganj police on Saturday arrested seven gamblers and seized Rs 66,440 cash, one country made pistol of 0.12 bore along with three cartridges and other valuables when these gamblers were enjoying on mela campus. The arrested gamblers were identified as Jafar Abbas of Shivkuti, Aslam Ali of Sarayinayat, Dinesh Jaiswal of Rajapur, Ram Chandra Nishad of Mehdauri, Anil Kumar Sharma of Malviya Nagar, Manas Sonkar of Attarsuiya and Sethi Bharatiya of Jhunsi.

The gamblers were arrested by police at a time when few days are left for the beginning of month long Magh Mela.

Title: Chennithala: Why is CM afraid of guv?
Content:
This story is from January 5, 2020

Thrissur: Opposition leader Ramesh Chennithala on Saturday slammed chief minister Pinarayi Vijayan for his silence even as governor Arif Mohammed Khan was “continuously denigrating the decisions taken by the assembly”.

“I fail to understand why Vijayan is afraid of the governor. He should at least display the boldness demonstrated by CPM state secretary Kodiyeri Balakrishnan. The chief minister, who is the leader of the House, has not yet spoken up even though so many days have lapsed after the governor slighted the resolution against Citizenship Amendment Act passed by the assembly. The silence of Vijayan is suspicious. He should not be trying to be in the good books of the governor, who has crossed the boundaries of all propriety expected from a person holding an important constitutional position,’’ said Chennithala during a news conference here.

The opposition leader asserted that the assembly was well within its rights to pass the resolution against CAA, which was against the basic tenets of the Constitution.

On the reports that a privilege motion is being moved against the chief minister in Parliament, Chennithala said: “If a privilege notice is moved in the Rajya Sabha, it can only be sent the state assembly. And, there can be no other action on it.”

“On January 30, UDF will form a human map of India in all 14 districts,” Chennithala said, adding that there would no more joint agitation with CPM.

Two held for trying to wave black flags against guv

Two activists from the Youth Congress and KSU were taken into custody on Saturday when they tried to wave black flags against the governor. The governor was here to inaugurate a workshop/exhibition titled ‘Value Addition for Income Generation in Agriculture’ (VAIGA) and to attend a programme at the Kerala Police Academy. The KSU district secretary V S David and Youth Congress activist M V Arun were arrested from the Palace Road area as they tried to wave black flags when the governor was proceeding to VAIGA venue.

Title: 1 booked for blackmailing woman
Content:
This story is from January 5, 2020

Kanpur:The city police booked a man on Friday for allegedly blackmailing a woman by threatening to upload her objectionable photo on social media and to make it viral.

The FIR stated that the woman from Jharkhand came in contact with one Pradeep Kumar of Barra area of the city. She fell in love with Pradeep, who promised to marry her.

The accused had shot some obscene photos of his intimate moments with the woman. The accused started blackmailing her and threatened her to post the objectionable photographs on social media. She said Pradeep wanted to seek revenge after the couple had parted ways a few days ago following a heated argument. The woman’s brother approached the local police and lodged an FIR on Friday.

Based on the complaint, police filed a case and started investigation. “We have lodged an FIR under relevant sections of IPC, besides IT Act against the accused,” said Inspector Barra Satish Singh.

Title: ‘Don’t know about pro-CAA postcards’
Content: Ahmedabad: As scores of postcards thanking the PM on bringing Citizenship Amendment Act (CAA), written by schoolchildren, are collected by BJP workers in the city, AMC school board chairperson Lagdhir Desai on Saturday said that he was not aware of this campaign, and ‘there are no official orders’.“The issue has not come to our notice. There are no official orders on students writing such postcards,” said Desai.Sources close to development said that on Friday students of 15 schools in Ghatlodia area alone wrote postcards which were later collected by ward officials of BJP. Various functionaries of the ruling party have been allegedly given targets to collect the postcards supporting the Centre’s move. “It’s so organized that a teacher writes the content of the letter on the blackboard which the students copy and submit the postcard to a volunteer,” said an education department official close to the development.Vinod Rao, state education secretary, said that there has been no directive to schools for such an activity. When questioned on whether the schools reported to have conducted the activity would face any action, he refused to comment.BJP functionaries claimed it’s a voluntary activity and they have not been to schools. “Yes, the drive is on where our volunteers are stationed outside various colleges, requesting the students to write in support of CAA, but we are not asking school students to write postcards,” said Prashant Vala, a BJP spokesperson.Those against the move said that the children are too young to understand the issue.

Title: Keep chicken, mutton in & around cages to lure killer leopard: WII experts
Content:
This story is from January 5, 2020

Bijnor: Two experts from Dehradun-based Wildlife Institute of India (WII) arrived here on Saturday to aide the forest department authorities to capture the elusive leopardess which is believed to have killed three of the five people in the district since November 27. Pugmarks have proved that the same animal killed three of the five people in Bijnor tehsil over the past few weeks. Scores of people have also been injured in leopard attacks in the region. People have reported sighting leopards amid the cane fields.

People in the rural areas have been on the edge as the killer leopard is yet to be captured. Their fear also stems from the fact that it is harvesting time for cane crop and they have to go to their fields for the purpose.

The killer big cat is suspected to be hiding amid cane fields in a one-km radius of Mohandiya village close to Malan river.

According to Bijnor divisional forest officer M Semmaran, two WII experts -- Salvador and Dushyant Rai -- who inspected the area suggested that forest authorities install 10 more camera traps. They advised that chicken, mutton and dog meat besides eggs be placed in and around the cages kept to trap the leopard. The smell of raw meat will lure the animal to the cages, they added.

Till now, forest authorities were keeping live dogs and goat as bait inside the cages to trap it.

Several cages and camera traps have been set up one-km radius of Mohandiya village close to Malan river. That the killer big cat is a leopardess was captured by the cameras. However, it has not entered any of the cages set up to trap it. Forest authorities have also sought permission from a top officer to tranquilize it and are planning to hire three elephants trained for combing sugarcane fields.

Title: Lucknow: After onion tears, garlic may now fly off your plate
Content: LUCKNOW: Garlic , the champion of seasoning in Indian kitchens that arguably keeps blood cholesterol under check, may do the vanishing act from Lucknow pretty soon.City markets are already showing signs of a crisis with only one out of every five vendors selling garlic and stocks dwindling fast at the four major retail mandis. Prices have also rocketed from Rs 80-100 a kilo in October to Rs 250-280 (as on Thursday), depending on quality, and the spike is a fresh blow to both buyers and sellers who have barely recovered from onion tears.When TOI surveyed mandis on Thursday, vendors at Narhi in Hazratganj , Dandahiya in Aliganj , Bhootnath in Indiranagar and Mithaiwala crossing in Gomtinagar said there had been no supply of garlic for over two months and fresh supply was expected only after another two months. “What we are selling today is from the stock we bought in October. It will run out in a few days and no fresh supply is expected till March. The demand has gone down owing to spiralling prices,” said Uday Raj, a vendor in Gomtinagar. Wholesalers blamed production slump in 2019 for the supply crunch.

Title: Uttar Pradesh: Congress leaders offer help to anti-CAA protesters to pursue legal cases against police brutalities
Content:
This story is from January 5, 2020

Congress leader Raashid Alvi

AGRA: A group of Congress leaders, including Raashid Alvi and Panna Lal Punia along with scores of party workers, met the family members of December 20 anti-CAA violence victims and prime accused Faraz Khan, and extended all possible help.

Party’s national spokesperson Punia said, “We met the families and came to know that they have not received autopsy reports of those who died in December 20 violence. The report will help us expedite the case for a government compensation. People narrated their ordeal to us. Hence, we helped them connect with our veteran party leader Salman Khurshid over phone for legal aid.”

Azad Khan (43), uncle of Faraz Khan who has been accused by police for leading violent anti-CAA protests, said, “The Congress leaders heard us patiently. I also spoke to Salman Khurshid over phone and he offered to provide legal expertise in Faraz’s case. My nephew has been wrongly framed, he is just a 19-year-old boy. His life will be destroyed if he is not rescued on time. We have evidence to prove his innocence in a court of law.”

Mohammad Ayub, father of deceased Navee Jaan, said, “Like others, I too haven’t received the postmortem report of my son. I’m not aware of the procedure to obtain it. The Congress leaders have assured me that they will help me in fighting against police brutalities. He was the sole breadwinner of our family.”

Zaki Sheikh, brother-in-law of Haroon (33) who succumbed in Delhi due to injuries sustained on December 20, said, “No political party leader came to meet us. However, authorities have informed us that autopsy report is yet to arrive from AIIMS Delhi.”

Firozabad superintendent of police (city) Prabal Pratap Singh said, “We are yet to receive the autopsy reports of those who died in Delhi. For the ones done in Firozabad, the families have not submitted applications yet. We will help them in this regard.”

Title: Path lab scam: Accused doctors appear before cops
Content:
This story is from January 5, 2020

Vadodara: Two doctors booked in the path lab scam in Vadu appeared before the police after obtaining anticipatory bail from the Gujarat high court. The duo – Dr Sunil Surve and Dr Manish Hadiya – remained present at the Vadu police station on Friday morning as the high court had directed them to as one of the bail conditions.

After interrogation, the police allowed the duo to go. “We did not got much details of the case from them and so we will call them again for questioning. If they continue to not cooperate, we will seek their remand,” said a police official. Surve, a pathologist at GMERS Medical College and Hospital-Gotri, was booked after his signatures were found in the reports at Swara Path Lab which was sealed by the health department after the scam came to light.

Title: Ex-IAS officer Kannan Gopinathan held by Agra police on way to AMU
Content:
This story is from January 5, 2020

Former IAS officer Kannan Gopinathan

AGRA: Former IAS officer Kannan Gopinathan, who quit the services over curbs in Jammu & Kashmir after abrogation of Article 370, was detained by Agra police while he was on his way to Aligarh Muslim University (AMU) to deliver a speech on CAA and NRC. Gopinathan was invited by the AMU Resident Doctors’ Association (RDA) to express his views at a public discussion on CAA, NPR and NRC.

Gopinathan, who had tweeted on Saturday afternoon that he had been detained from the UP border, near Agra, was released late on Saturday evening.

Gopinathan later told TOI that he was escorted by the Agra police to the UP border, even after he was told that he had been released on a personal bond. He said, “I was detained without any reason.”

He said, “I have never made any provocative speech. Why was I illegally detained? I told them this was a kidnapping. The police personnel did not take me to the police station. First they took me to a dhaba and then to the dak bungalow,” he said.

Alleging that the government was scared of being questioned, the former IAS officer said, “They aren’t allowing anyone to speak. The government is scared of dissent and dubs any kind of educated dissent ‘urban naxalism’.”

According to Agra administration, Gopinathan was detained at Saiyan toll plaza on Agra-Gwalior highway and was taken to a rest house (dak bungalow) in Kheragarh.

Though Aligarh district magistrate refused to comment on the issue, a letter issued by the district administration to the police said, “In order to maintain law and order in the city, Gopinathan should not be allowed to enter Aligarh.” The letter also stated that there is a “possibility of disruption of peace after Gopinathan’s address to students, as it had happened earlier”.

The letter mentioned how violence had erupted on AMU campus on December 15, following speeches by Dr Kafeel Khan, the lecturer who was suspended from the department of paediatrics at BRD Medical College in Gorakhpur, and activist and political analyst Yogendra Yadav on the campus on CAA two days earlier.

Later, talking to TOI, activist Kavita Krishnan, who was also invited by AMU students to speak on CAA, criticized the government’s move and wondered under what law Gopinathan was detained.

“It is atrocious. He did not commit a crime,” said Krishnan, adding that not only his movement was prevented but his phone was also taken away. “If this could happen to a former IAS officer then imagine what the government will do with the minorities,” said Krishnan.

AMU students’ leader Faizul Hassan said, “Gopinathan was singled out by the district administration as he is aware of the government policies and could have exposed the government on its lies on CAA.”

Gopinathan was the secretary, power department of the Union Territories of Daman and Diu, and Dadra and Nagar Haveli when he resigned August 21 last year over the denial of “freedom of expression” to the people of Jammu and Kashmir following the abrogation of Article 370.

The 32-year-old 2012-batch IAS officer had first come into limelight when he hid his identity and joined in relief work during the 2018 Kerala floods.

Title: First pier of Kanpur Metro priority corridor complete
Content:
